body_content.explanation: a plant like tall grass that grows in marshes (= very wet ground near a lake, a river, or the sea) and has flowers that form a brown spike (= narrow thin shape with a point at one end) at the top of the stem:
examples: After the first warm rain of the spring, peepers emerged on cattail stems and sang a high-pitched song all night.
The river enters into an area of marsh that is full of bulrush and cattail.
